definition: Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary
surname Quan

sentences.english: When Sun Quan reached the city walls, arrows rained down on him, and one struck his plumed helmet.
sentences.chinese: 權自到城下看時，城上箭如雨發，射中孫權麾蓋。

sentences.english: Sun Quan, fearing for Ling Tong, ordered Lv Meng to bring him back to camp.
sentences.chinese: 孫權恐淩統有失，令呂蒙接應回營。

sentences.english: Sun then remembered his brother's words and asked the servant to send for Chou Yu at once.
sentences.chinese: 一句話提醒了孫權，馬上派人到鄱陽請周瑜來。

sentences.english: It's the tomb of the Wu Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 而是三國東吳國王孫權的墓。

sentences.english: Despite being greatly outnumbered, Liu Bei and Sun Quan eventually won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 儘管兵力懸殊，劉備和孫權最後還是打贏了這場戰役。

sentences.english: It has been extended to Sun Quan's 58th generation of descendants.
sentences.chinese: 如今已經延續到孫權的第五十八代子孫了。

sentences.english: They are all Sun Quan's descendants living in Longmen.
sentences.chinese: 他們都是居住在龍門鎮的孫權後裔。

sentences.english: Zhao Wei will play Sun Shangxiang, the little sister of Sun Quan, the emperor of the Wu Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 趙薇將在影片中扮演吳國皇帝孫權的小妹孫上香。

sentences.english: He is the 55th generation descendant of Sun Quan.
sentences.chinese: 他是龍門孫氏孫權後裔的五十五世。

sentences.english: Was Sun Quan the emperor of the State of Wu during the Three Kingdom Period?
sentences.chinese: 那麼孫權就是三國鼎立時的吳國皇帝是嗎？

sentences.english: Sun Quan tried with patience to persuade him to read more .
sentences.chinese: 孫權耐心地勸他多讀一些書。

sentences.english: Over 7,000 of his descendants live here.
sentences.chinese: 這裏居住着孫權後裔中的七千多人。

sentences.english: Elated, Zhuge Jin went with Kongming to see Xuande and represent Sun Quan’s letter.
sentences.chinese: 瑾大喜，即同孔明入見玄德，呈上孫權書。

sentences.english: " a "matter of course Sun Quan also carrying a parachute jump.
sentences.chinese: “一個”孫權也理所當然揹着降落傘跳了。

definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
skilled manipulator/tactician/strategist/advisor/counsellor
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
to go on a punitive expedition
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Sichuan/the state of Shu in Sichuan at different periods/the Shu Han dynasty (214-263) of Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 during the Three Kingdoms
army provisions/rations and fodder

Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
